tit.j: イルティッシュ号投降事件

sen.j: イルティッシュ号投降事件（イルティッシュごうとうこうじけん）は、日本海海戦で損傷を受けたロシアのバルチック艦隊の特務艦イルティッシュ号が航行不能となり、1905年（明治38年）5月28日午後2時頃、島根県那賀郡都濃村和木（現・江津市和木町）で投降した事件。
sen.e: The Irtysh surrender incident is the incident in which the crew of a special service vessel of the Russian Baltic Fleet called the Irtysh, which had been damaged in the Battle of Tsushima and stalled at sea, surrendered in Waki district, Tsuno village, Naka County (present-day Waki town, Gotsu City), Shimane Prefecture at about 2:00 pm on May 28, 1905.

The Irtysh surrender incident is the incident in which the crew of a special service vessel of the Russian Baltic Fleet called the Irtysh, which had been damaged in the Battle of Tsushima and stalled at sea, surrendered in Waki district, Tsuno village, Naka County (present-day Waki town, Gotsu City), Shimane Prefecture at about 2:00 pm on May 28, 1905.

The Irtysh surrender incident is the incident in which the crew of a special service vessel of the Russian Baltic Fleet called the Irtysh, which had been damaged in the Battle of Tsushima and stalled at sea, surrendered in Waki district, Tsuno village, Naka County (present-day Waki town, Gotsu City), Shimane Prefecture at about 2:00 pm on May 28, 1905.

sen.j: イルティッシュ号は、ドイツ海軍の石炭運送船ベリギヤ号（7,500トン）として1903年にドイツで建造された。
sen.e: The Irtysh was built in Germany in 1903 as a collier of the German Navy, named Belgien (7,500 tons).

sen.j: 1904年にロシアがドイツより購入し、艦隊に所属させるために200万ルーブルをかけて改装した。
sen.e: Russia purchased the vessel from Germany in 1904 and remodeled her with 2 million rubles to attach her to the fleet.

sen.j: この改装により石炭艙は各種積荷の貯蔵のため乾燥室と石炭室に分割され、名前も西シベリアを流れるオビ川左岸の支流エルティシ川（全長4,248km）からイルティッシュ号と命名された。
sen.e: By this remodeling the coal hold was divided into a drying room and a coal room in order to store various kinds of freight and the vessel was named the Irtysh after the Irtysh River (the total length: 4,248 km), a tributary on the left bank of the Ob River in Western Siberia.

sen.e: The crew consisted of 251 members (17 commissioned officers, 6 warrant officers and 228 seamen) and 235 out of them, who were from Russia, Ukraine, Belarus, Tatar, Germany, Latvia, Estonia and so on; were on duty when the Irtysh surrendered.

sen.e: The Irtysh was to join the Baltic Fleet which had Lieutenant General Rozhdestvensky as the admiral in the Russo-Japanese War.

sen.e: However, when they were loading coal in a hurry before departure, the loads were thrown off balance and damaged the ship; it required two months to repair.

sen.j: このため、1904年10月15日に出港した本隊から約2ヶ月遅れの12月24日にバルト海のリエパーヤ軍港を出港した。
sen.e: For this reason, about two months behind the main unit of the fleet left on October 15, 1904, the Irtysh left the naval port Libau on the Baltic Sea on December 24.

sen.e: The Irtysh was shot in three places of her body (on the right of the second hatch, the social hall on the deck, and the foreship) during the naval battle and filled with water; the compass also got broken and the steam boiler exploded.
